Lg8XSZaH4vyvNqS6eklYzA.text: Through working in the Edinburgh office for the first time today and this place was highly recommended by one of my colleagues. So glad I checked it out.  Quaint little place with lovely, friendly staff and a great selection of sandwiches. I opted for their 'Vegan Supreme' roll and it was so good. It came in a lovely brown sub roll with seeds, rocket, falafel, sweet potato cubes, pine nuts, some sort of sweet chilli jam or relish, onions and probably some other wonderful stuff. They had some nice looking cakes and can make sandwiches/baked potatoes etc up on request too. The coffee smells like it could also be a winner. Prices are reasonable for Edinburgh, especially on the Royal Mile.   There are a few seats at the back of the shop and a few up front. I popped myself out front since it was such a nice day. There's free Wi-Fi if you need it, just ask for the code.   Prices are really reasonable for Edinburgh and how fresh the ingredients tasted.  Look forward to visiting there again whenever I'm back through. Hopefully soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside the &#39;Vegan Supreme&#39;
Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ACCzRDmdkCN4rlVNVzThkA.text: Do you like stale toast with your breakfast, or dirty lettuce in your salad? Do you really love long waits for your food, especially when there is no one else in the restaurant? Or really weird and awkward service?   On a Monday morning, there was no one in the deli when we arrived. My husband ordered one of their "Hearty Plated breakfasts", which the menu clearly states is served "With fruit juice, toast and leaf tea or Americano." He asked for orange juice and tea. I ordered one of their focaccias.  Then a number of takeout customers walked in. We watched as the lady occupied herself making their sandwiches. My husband's tea came 15 minutes later, after they had all received their orders and left.  Our meals arrived at least another 15 minutes after that. Over 30 minutes' wait for a sandwich and a standard breakfast. The orange juice never arrived. My husband asked the lady about his orange juice.  "You have to order it," she said, making it sound as though it were not actually included in the breakfast and would actually be charged separately.  We reviewed the menu which declared otherwise. I took the menu up to her at the counter. "Excuse me, so the menu says that juice and tea are both included, is this not True?"  "Yes, but you have to order it, you didn't ask for it." What? Even supposing that we had not asked for the orange juice, should you not have asked, "The breakfast comes with fruit juice. what kind would you like?" And when we did ask you about it, should you not have just said, "Oh yes, I will bring you some" rather than responding as though its absence was somehow due to a failure on our part?  In retrospect, it all makes sense-- we didn't ask for FRESH toast, so we received STALE toast. I didn't ask for CLEAN lettuce in my focaccia's side salad, so I received DIRTY lettuce. We didn't ask for reasonably efficient service, so we received slow and inefficient service.  I asked for the orange juice and she begrudgingly poured a small glass for me.  Even as a cheap eat, this place is not worth the money, not worth the time, not worth the trouble.

lHAfIdX3znFIqCZmZ923yg.text: Sugarhouse Sandwiches is located on the Royal Mile.  It's surrounded by a plethora of eateries, but I was walking past and their "home made soup" sign grabbed my attention.  I was looking for a good, simple, and inexpensive lunch, so I went in.  The soup atmosphere was cozy and friendly, and the soup was delicious!  The staff are friendly and effiecnent, and were totally unphased when I asked for a different combination than what was shown on the menu.  I look forward to returning :-)

_nKzYFoVuOkzjLCnA5X2_A.text: Stopped in for breakfast one morning since it was very close to the flat we were renting during our stay.  Not crowded, either.  The waitress was very friendly, but we had trouble communicating.  I ordered one of the breakfast rolls and thought it was something different than what it turned out to be.  It didn't make much of a difference to me, in the end - I just ended up eating the breakfast meats without the bun.  The fried egg was fantastic.  The coffee was adorable, with little hearts in the foam.  Nice quiet spot for breakfast, and a nice alternative to the chain coffee shops that are everywhere.  I'd definitely stop back in if I had the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ZygzeF7CBZbVuXD_BlkoAQ.text: Stumbled upon this place by chance and was blown away! They make their food fresh in home, and you can tell. It's small and charming. I got a panini (which was made and grilled right after ordering) and a homemade roast vegetable soup. Very happy, as it was very filling and delicious! Staff was very friendly as well

EJovsQHLZzaUJR4Mte_TQA.text: Amazing find while visiting Edinburgh! We stopped in here for a warm breakfast on the way back from Arthur's Seat and were pleasantly surprised with the friendly service and delicious food. I would highly recommend the porridge with honey - so simple and delicious. They also have sandwiches and pastries to go, if you're in a rush. This is a family-owned business and the food is cooked fresh, so it may take some time for your order to arrive but it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zCH9zV2DFkFu85QMYFc-6g.text: We were ready for some grub after coming down from the top of Arthur's Seat and we needed a retreat from the rain. Mushroom soup was good and panini was delicious. Owner was very friendly, accommodating, and very hospitable.

photos.caption: Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hungarian mushroom soup
Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Panini

n_1ACT--SDsQFwz2iefNUA.text: Lovely sandwiches! Had a Brie, cranberry, and bacon bagel sandwich with a latte. Light and fairly priced food. Staff was extremely friendly and good came out quick. Great stop for a quick lunch on the royal mile.

9c7DHITDCom1Dmg7asdwUA.text: A snug little place, perfect to get out of the rain for a DELICIOUS lunch!  The vegan supreme gets high marks from my family.  Family run, very welcoming, seats for up to 12 people.  ENJOY

photos.caption: Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Hungarian mushroom soup!
Photo of Sugarhouse Sandwiches - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Brie, bacon and cranberry panini, YUM

Q--HchQLP9Yu5-WsAH3_mA.text: A tiny little joint in the Canongate at the foot of the Royal Mile. My father was born and raised just a few doors away. The owner (from Newcastle) is super nice and both the Vegan Supreme sandwich and Hungarian Mushroom soup (also vegan) were superb. The rest of our non-vegan group loved what they ate. A great option for vegan (or not) lunch at this end of town.

lDGK8uIafTCqVKQMwkJCVw.text: After touring all up and down the Royal Mile, we came across this hidden oasis of wonderful food.  The Panini sandwiches were to die for.  Nice mid afternoon snack.  A couple of iced coffee's and we were just like new to keep going on exploring the different sights.  Great prices, Location and Service,

ZPEvqF9ugVNneBlpZfiycg.text: I spotted Sugarhouse Sandwiches when on my way to Wedgwood, the other day. It looked worth a visit, so I was glad to get an early chance to give it a whirl. Sandwiches are very good and the soup is also very tasty, so I'd recommend it for a lunchtime pit-stop. Their meal deal of soup and filled roll for 4 represents decent value.  Overall, we said: "Sugarhouse Sandwiches served me very nicely, today. The walk up Jacob's Ladder, to get back to my office, did return the burn to my legs for the first time since our little Brighton escapade, so I'm not sure it will be an everyday place, but it will go somewhere on the regular rota."

S_DBWsjRAuKH96_UFoqhaA.text: We were so lucky to find Sugarhouse while staying on the Royal Mile. Not only were the prices reasonable, but the food was delicious and the staff friendly! We returned because it was so great. What a gem -- highly recommended.
